      • getGameModel

        public java.lang.String getGameModel(int version)
                              throws ServerException
        Description copied from interface: IServerProxy
        Returns the entire model of the game. This includes game board state, player state, resource allocation, etc.
        Specified by:
        getGameModel in interface IServerProxy
        Parameters:
        version - The version number of the model that the caller already has. You will only get a model back if the current model version on the server is newer than the version specified. Otherwise, you'll get a string "true" to notify the caller that it already has the current model state
        Returns:
        TODO So this API request returns either a game model object in JSON, or true. How should we deal with that?
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails

      • postCommands

        public java.lang.String postCommands(PostCommandsRequest postCommandsRequest)
                              throws ServerException
        Description copied from interface: IServerProxy
        Used for testing and debugging.
        Specified by:
        postCommands in interface IServerProxy
        Parameters:
        postCommandsRequest - is an array list of commands to be executed on the server. This is used after a user has logged in and joins a game. These commands are then re-run to restore the state of the game.
        Returns:
        The client model JSON for the game after the command list has been applied.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails

      • getCommands

        public java.lang.String getCommands()
                             throws ServerException
        Specified by:
        getCommands in interface IServerProxy
        Returns:
        For the default games created by the server, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed in the game since the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round).
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails

        Returns:

      • saveGame

        public boolean saveGame(SaveGameRequest saveRequest)
                 throws ServerException
        Description copied from interface: IServerProxy
        This is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, a player will use this method to save the current state of the game to a file and attach the file to a bug report.
        Specified by:
        saveGame in interface IServerProxy
        Parameters:
        saveRequest - The SaveGameRequest object containing the ID of the game the player wants to save, and the name of the file they want to save to.
        Returns:
        True if the game was successfully saved, false if not
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails

      • loadGame

        public boolean loadGame(LoadGameRequest loadRequest)
                 throws ServerException
        Description copied from interface: IServerProxy
        This is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, a player will save the game state to a file and attach that file to a bug report. This function can be used to load that saved game file.
        Specified by:
        loadGame in interface IServerProxy
        Parameters:
        loadRequest - the LoadGameRequest object containing the name of the save file
        Returns:
        True if the game was successfully loaded, false if not
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails

      • resetGame

        public java.lang.String resetGame()
                           throws ServerException
        Description copied from interface: IServerProxy
        For default games created by the server, this method reverts the game to the state immediately after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method reverts games to the very beginning (before the initial placement round). The return happens after the game has been reset. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        resetGame in interface IServerProxy
        Returns:
        the game model after the game has been reset.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If the server request fails
